page.title: 01BURTON PEDWARDINE
page.content: The Sleaford-Spalding railway line runs from North East to South West, also the Sleaford-Boston line, reduced to single line with automatic barriers in 1982, in the north. Mainly agricultural, growing cereals, sugar beet, oilseed rape and potatoes. there are seven farm holdings in the area and also three poultry rearing units. Burton Pedwardine has a small church but the school has closed. The population of the village and surrounding area work on the land or travel to Sleaford or other nearby towns to work using private vehicles or the once a day bus. Like most villages in the area Burton has problems with farming due to mud on the roads, straw burning and noise from explosive bird scarers even though there are laws and bylaws regulating the nuisances.
